comments.commentBody: Now it is time to recuse himself from all civil rights investigations. His predisposition to ignore race based denial of constitutional rights was clearly demonstrated in the last week by his refusal to even read reports about current investigations.
Mr. Buthod, That won't happen. He will stay on as AG, kicking and screaming, until saner heads prevail.

Stupid indeed to have elected a man and party whose economic record for the last 40 years has been abysmal for the working and middle classes by every measure. Simple math is all anyone needs to see that GOP economics is a shell game, still transferring money from the poor to the rich.But as long as Republicans have minorities and immigrants to blame, they don't need no stinking math. It really is the economy, so in fact it is stupid to be diverted into looking at anything but the fallacious numbers being served up by our 6 time bankrupt economist in chief.

Really thoughtful post. Two meetings is a stretch. Mtg #1 at an ambassador function with at least 25 other foreign ambassadors. Mtg # 2, one half hour with staffers present. Finally the ? from unqualified Franken had to do with the Trump campaign not senate responsibility. McCaskill, Schumer, Pelosi etc et al had mtgs that they failed to remember actually they lied I guess.

All that's needed now is the appearance of a Deep Throat 2 and we will have a De Je Vous  all over again as a former Yankee would say.  And the confederate AG will be taking his place in history.  And Maybe we can get back to a congress that will do it's job and investigate all the surprise meetings that  are appearing  after having been denied.  I think I'm going to need a score card to keep track.

There are two issues here. Firstly, there is no debate about Russian subversion of the US presidential election process. All the US intelligence agencies have confirmed it. This leads onto the question of the extent to which the Trump campaign were aware of this or a party to it.

The second issue is the extent of Russian knowledge of and involvement in the business affairs and social activities of Trump and his associates. There seems to be little doubt this is considerable and almost certainly explains Trump's unwillingness to release his tax returns. At the very least this leaves his administration open to blackmail.

The US intelligence agencies almost certainly know all about this and they are probably principally responsible for the leaking of all these tidbits. A process that is likely to continue. At the moment Trump is being protected by Republicans in congress in an astounding betrayal of the national interest. What is it going to take for this protection to be withdrawn?
These folks hang together to avoid getting hanged separately. They know they're over the line.

To avoid the power of blackmail the Trump people just need to tell Russia to f* off. Americans are so mesmerized by Trump that they will not care what comes out. Trump's people have nothing to be afraid of from the American people.  America knows what it was getting in Trump and they wanted it. We wanted jobs over Social Security, Medicare or health insurance. We wanted crappy water and air so businessmen could make more money and get lower taxes. and we wanted much lower taxes for the rich so the GOP could maximize campaign contributions. And finally we want taxpayer's to pay for school vouchers so young white Christian children do not have to go to school and learn science or be around African Americans.

@AACNY
New York

So why won't Trump release his tax returns?

Like many of her colleagues in what RL calls the "drive by media,"as well as the liberal elitists at the paper and those who contribute to the Comments section, Ms. Collins is still smarting from the defeat of her candidate last November, and is looking for "bouc emissaires,"someone to blame it on. Were Senator Sessions not a white,conservative southerner from the Heart of the Confederacy,I doubt that the liberal media would have attacked him so viciously. Senator Franken, who does not have a law degree, put a series of hypotheticals to the a.g., but was unable to go  further.So far, there is no evidence that RUSSIA under Putin intervened in the election, and if they had tried to, would that have changed the final result?Dems. r trying to undermine the Trump presidency, with Schumer leading the charge, but he, Pelosi, Hoyer inter alioshave very little credibility. Ms. Collins, hired by the paper to write humor,still has not learned that it is more effective to attack somebody with a scalpel(un coup de bistouri) than with an axe, metaphorically speaking.Columns that r so unabashedly, relentlessly partisan and predictable do not make for interesting reading. Wonder how Russell Baker or William Safire would have handled the subject of Senator Sessions's  testimony.Perhaps more deftly.

And we all know how subtle Trump, Pence et al are.
Besides, the Republicans are sticking their chins out begging "hit me". The Democrats are not undermining the Trump administration, Trump and his gang of fools are doing it to themselves.

I used to look forward to and enjoy the humor of a Gail Collins column. I still enjoy her insights, but it's not funny anymore. We are living a true national nightmare and one in which many millions of our fellow citizens have been duped into believing lies and accepting lies as a normal way of life.
Are you blaming her for this?

There will be no investigation, no resignation and no firing. The Trump-Sessions-Pence-Bannon tribe are only loyal to themselves and will bring down American democracy so that their vision of a white-christian America may prevail in some dystopian nightmare. Flynn was not fired because he lied to the American public; he was fired because he lied to the tribe. The rest of the American public are considered part of the tribe if they voted for them and gentiles if not; fair game for treachery, lies, violence and disenfranchisement.
The progressives can't go to polls in enough numbers and won't win if they do.  Their districts have been gerrymandered.

Yes, Jeff Sessions lied about talking to Russian officials and yes, Flynn lied about talking to Russian officials. But the real question is why? Jared Kushner met with the Russians and all of this while Trump was repeatedly singing Putin’s praises. Is anyone really going to get to the bottom of all of the reasons behind these meetings? If there is no story here, then why did they lie? There certainly is enough smoke here. The FBI are said to be investigating though Congressman Adam Schiff of California has stated that he is frustrated with the lack of information that has been forthcoming so far.

Republicans will not force Sessions out and Democrats cannot do it alone. While Sessions has many short comings in addition to this lie, there is a much bigger story here. While I can’t blame Democrats for jumping at the chance to turn the tables on the Republicans who relentlessly pushed for special investigations into Hillary’s emails, Benghazi and endless lawsuits against President Obama, they need to be patient and get the full Russian story. They need to keep the pressure on the FBI.

Duh, D. Then shackle serial-baiter Franken and force him to henceforth submit questions in writing 12 hours in advance. Or better yet, have him replace always-searching-for-a-life-not-so-smart Alec Baldwin in almost-failed SNL.

Listen, the joke is on the Democrats. A full three months after the election, they remain splintered, clueless, headless chickens on national stage, their only strategy being to scream foul at anything and everything. Needless to say, their only achievement with all that has been to assure further humiliation in 2018. The last laugh? No, the continuing laughs. Thanks.

There is no joke here.
We have people in power who are treasonous
lying crooks at all levels.
It's no longer a question of democrats and republicans.
We are all Americans and our democracy is in serious trouble.
This is not the democrats fault,
If this were Mrs. Clinton, she would have already been impeached. I guess republicans get Carte Blanche to commit treason.

Russian ambassador Sergey Kislyak is a large man with no shadow. All these Trump officials forget that they had meetings with him and can not recall the content of the conversations. He is a spy who sleeps on a memory-foam mattress and leaves no impression.

Lately, Ms. C., our 17 agencies for "security" all indicate that there was meddling by the Russians in the 2016 election.
Wow.
One big question: does The Donald owe Putin something after all of his deals in Russia? if so, then what?

We would like to think that an "investigation" will answer such a question.
No wonder Trump refuses to disclose his tax info.
Gosh.

He didn't misspeak. He lied. It's right there in the transcript of his exchange with Al Franken. You're working way too hard to analyze this. A lie is a lie is a lie. He lied to Franken directly, and to Leahy in a questionnaire.

misspeak: express oneself insufficiently clearly or accurately

lie: a false statement made with deliberate intent to deceive; an intentional untruth; a falsehood.

He lied. Case closed.

Definitely both, Gail!! Fire than prosecute. Ok, so Jeff Sessions recused himself under fire. Big deal. How is that going to give the Justice Dept. the freedom it needs to investigate this matter honestly? How many DOJ staff are under his direct control and answer to him? (The answer is all of them.) The entire Justice Dept. must be recused and Sessions needs to resign. What little credibility he had is gone forever.

Sessions won't quit as long as black people can vote anywhere.
The guy just flat out lied. his defense- I did not understand
Franken's question. they never taught the word "any" in the
segregated schools of my youth. Oh those communications,
those meerings? funny how his memory improved during
his tongue bath on Fox with Trumpapologist Carlson.

I would like to read more on the Wilbur Ross/Trump/Fla/Deutsch Bank connection as well. As far as his tax returns, he's probably got far more personal debt than he has divulged to his creditors. Then again, he could very well be lying on his tax returns which could easily be investigated should the returns ever see the light of day. The fact is that he must have SOME reason not to make his returns public.

The Russian ambassador was in Cleveland during the GOP convention only because he loves Cleveland in the summer and he has alway cherished Cleveland's food and drink. He didn't even know a convention was going on.

Republicans in to Congress (and the F.B.I.) howled like mad dogs over Benghazi and a private e-mail server. These same people seem mostly okay with Senator Sessions lying under oath and the possible complicity of the Trump campaign with the Russian government to interfere in a U.S. election.

This is somewhat beyond stunning.

it's only stunning if you still think that republicans actually give a flying fig about the country.  eight years of Obama obstruction (racism), a willingness to shut down the government and default on the national debt, and millions of dollars and countless hours wasted on demonizing Hillary--but not really wasted, as they succeeded in getting the hillbillies to hate her and vote for trump--are proof positive that the republicans care only for two things:  white men and money.

Why did Flynn and Sessions lie about contacts with Russian officials?  If there were nothing to hide,  why lie?  The obvious answer is that they are trying to cover up something.  What were they up to?  We need a special prosecutor to find out.

The Russian ambassador is considered by our intelligence agencies to be one of Russia's top spies and spy recruiters. Feedback from him would be of no value other than propaganda value for the Russians.

David From made a good point: following Sessions will take us away from the Russian nesting dolls, not toward it. He probably lied because he knows it's a hornet's nest waiting to explode. Follow the others--Frum, Kushner, Don Jr., Manafort. . . . that's where the answers will be.

From also opposes a special prosecutor, as they ONLY investigate and reveal law-breaking and won't reveal any of the questionable but legal goings on Trump & Co. have had with the Russians.

And I add: Follow the money! Let's see those pesky tax returns! Someone's been financing Trump since the NYC banks put him on the Do Not Call list in the early 1990s. Was it the Russians? That's the word on the street.

Regaining stride with this column, our favorite wit allows the genuineness of the emergency to peek through. I think we'd drained what little had been left of mere mockery, for weathering these unrelenting menaces.
Sessions is safe unless he pursues Trump's taxes. Then he would be gone in a news cycle.
My question too:  why would a foreign ambassador go to a convention?  Maybe he wore one of those big fur Russian hats to fit in with the goofy hat contingent.
